get_node_stats_str(start: int, end: int, repl_idx: int) → str
get_value() → List[Any]
plot_node(axes: Axes, sample_idx: Optional[int] = None, repl_idx: int = 0, repl_size: int = 1, branch_attr: Optional[str] = 'state') → None

_summary_

Parameters:
  • axes (matplotlib.pyplot.Axes) – _description_
  • sample_idx (int, optional) – Which sample to plot. Defaults to 0.
  • repl_idx (int, optional) – Which tree replicate to plot (one tree is plotted at a time). Defaults to 0.
  • repl_size (int, optional) – How many scalar random variables to plot at a time. Defaults to 1.
  • branch_attr (str, optional) – Which discrete attribute associated to a branch length to color by. Defaults to “state”.

class phylojunction.pgm.pgm.ValueGenerator

n_repl()
n_samples()
phylojunction.pgm.pgm.abstract_attribute(obj: Optional[Callable[[Any], R]] = None) → R
phylojunction.pgm.pgm.extract_value_from_nodepgm(val_list: List[Union[NodePGM, str]]) → List[str]

Return list of values

If all elements are strings, returns copy of ‘val_list’. When elements are StochasticNodePGMs, replaces those objects by their values after casting to string (their values must be within a list).

If StochasticNodePGMs objects do not have .value field or if they cannot be string-fied, raise exception.
